title: Getting Started
text: This page will guide you through your initial setup. Complete these steps before Phase 1.

title: Getting Started
text: This page will guide you through your initial setup. Complete these steps before Phase 1.

title: Getting Started
text:
Step 1: Download Your Workspace (5 minutes)
Visit the Resources page and download the Liaison_Vault.zip file.
Extract it to a location like: - Mac/Linux: ~/Documents/Liaison_Vault - Windows: C:\Users\YourName\Documents\Liaison_Vault

title: Getting Started
text:
Step 2: Install Obsidian (5 minutes)

Go to obsidian.md and download Obsidian
Install it on your computer
Open Obsidian and select ‚ÄúOpen folder as vault‚Äù
Navigate to your Liaison_Vault folder and open it

First time in Obsidian? - Click the folder icon on the left sidebar to see your vault structure - Open 00_START_HERE.md to read your orientation guide

title: Getting Started
text:
Step 3: Configure Obsidian Settings (3 minutes)
Once your vault is open in Obsidian:

Go to Settings (gear icon, bottom left)
Click Files & Links in the sidebar
Under ‚ÄúDefault location for new attachments‚Äù, select 04_Resources
This ensures all images, PDFs, and media files go to the right place

title: Getting Started
text:
Step 4: Explore Your Vault Structure
Your vault contains:








Folder
Purpose
Action




00_Inbox
Quick notes & ideas
Capture thoughts here first


01_Journal
Weekly reflections
Use the template to reflect each week


02_Literature
Reading notes
Store all your research notes here


03_Project
Active research work
Organize by prospectus, codebook, data, drafts


04_Resources
Media & attachments
Images, PDFs, external files


99_Templates
Reusable templates
Copy these to start assignments

title: Getting Started
section: Step 5: Review the Weekly Journal Template (5 minutes)
text:
Step 5: Review the Weekly Journal Template (5 minutes)
Open 99_Templates ‚Üí Weekly_Journal_Template.md
This template guides you to reflect using one of three thinking paths: - The Connector: How does this apply to my project? - The Troubleshooter: What broke and how did I fix it? - The Critic: Does this hold true in my experience?

title: Getting Started
text:
Step 6: You‚Äôre Ready!
Once you complete these steps, move to Phase 1: Orientation in the sidebar to begin.

title: Getting Started
text:
Troubleshooting
Q: I extracted the ZIP file but Obsidian won‚Äôt open it as a vault - Make sure you‚Äôre opening the folder that contains the .obsidian hidden folder - Try right-clicking the folder and checking ‚ÄúShow hidden files‚Äù if needed
Q: Where do I put my weekly journal entries? - Create a new file in 01_Journal named something like Week_01_MyName.md - Copy the template from 99_Templates/Weekly_Journal_Template.md and fill it out
Q: Can I share my vault with classmates? - Yes! You can email them the ZIP file, or sync it via Git/GitHub for collaborative projects

Questions? Reach out via your course management system or check your course syllabus for contact information.

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text: In this phase, you‚Äôll: - Understand your role as a Communication Liaison - Set up your digital workspace - Learn the program structure - Get familiar with Obsidian and your vault

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text: In this phase, you‚Äôll: - Understand your role as a Communication Liaison - Set up your digital workspace - Learn the program structure - Get familiar with Obsidian and your vault

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
What is a Communication Liaison?
Edit this section with your course context and examples.
A Communication Liaison bridges the gap between: - Data scientists who understand the numbers - Creative teams who understand the audience - Project stakeholders who understand the goals
Your job is to translate, facilitate, and document.

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
The Five-Phase Journey
Phase 1 ‚Üí Phase 2 ‚Üí Phase 3 ‚Üí Phase 4 ‚Üí Phase 5
Orientation Discovery Dictionary Execution Delivery
Each phase builds skills you‚Äôll use throughout your career.

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
Activities for Phase 1

Activity 1: Complete Your Setup (Homework)

Go to the Resources page and download Liaison_Vault.zip
Follow the Setup Guide step-by-step
Configure your Obsidian vault
Open your 00_START_HERE.md file

Due: Before our next meeting


Activity 2: Explore Your Vault (In Class)

Open your Liaison_Vault in Obsidian
Create a file in 00_Inbox named First_Reflection.md
Write 3-5 sentences about what you hope to learn this semester



Activity 3: Vault Navigation Tour (Self-Paced)
Navigate through each folder and understand: - What goes in each folder - How folders connect to each other - Why the structure matters for your thinking

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
Key Concepts

The Liaison Mindset

Translate: Turn jargon into clarity
Facilitate: Help people understand each other
Document: Create records for future reference
Guide: Lead projects toward success



Tools You‚Äôll Use

Obsidian - Your personal knowledge system
GitHub - Version control and collaboration
Quarto - Documentation and reporting
Data tools - R, Python, Excel (in later phases)

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
Reflection Prompt
Before moving to Phase 2, write a journal entry in 01_Journal/ answering:
‚ÄúWhat does it mean to be a Communication Liaison in my field? Who do I need to bridge gaps between?‚Äù
Use one of the three thinking paths: 1. The Connector - How does this relate to what I already know? 2. The Troubleshooter - What challenges might I face? 3. The Critic - Does this resonate with my experience?

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:

üîó [External resources - add links here]

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
Next Steps
Once you complete Phase 1: 1. ‚úÖ Vault is set up and configured 2. ‚úÖ You‚Äôve explored all folders 3. ‚úÖ You‚Äôve written your first journal reflection 4. ‚Üí Move to Phase 2: Discovery

Questions? Use your Inbox in Obsidian or reach out during office hours.

title: Data Dictionary
text:
Data Dictionary









Variable Name
Conceptual Definition (The Dictionary)
Operational Definition (The Checklist)
Levels of Measurement




frame_type
The dominant angle of the story.
1 = Economic, 2 = Conflict, 3 = Human Interest
Nominal


tone
The emotional feeling of the text.
Count of negative words vs positive words.
Ratio

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
Welcome! As a Communication Liaison, you are the vital bridge between our data scientists and creative teams. Your role is to:

Translate complex data concepts into clear, actionable insights
Facilitate collaboration between technical and creative professionals
Document findings and processes for team understanding
Guide projects from discovery through delivery

This program is designed to equip you with the research methodologies, tools, and frameworks you need to excel in this unique position. Over five phases, you‚Äôll develop the skills to navigate data-driven projects while maintaining clear communication across all stakeholders.

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
Welcome! As a Communication Liaison, you are the vital bridge between our data scientists and creative teams. Your role is to:

Translate complex data concepts into clear, actionable insights
Facilitate collaboration between technical and creative professionals
Document findings and processes for team understanding
Guide projects from discovery through delivery

This program is designed to equip you with the research methodologies, tools, and frameworks you need to excel in this unique position. Over five phases, you‚Äôll develop the skills to navigate data-driven projects while maintaining clear communication across all stakeholders.

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
Quick Start
Ready to begin your journey? Start with our setup guide to configure your workspace and understand the program structure.
‚Üí Get Started

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
Essential Resources
Download the Liaison Obsidian Vault ‚Äî your complete knowledge management system with templates, structure, and documentation to succeed in this program.
‚Üí Download Liaison_Vault.zip
Or visit the Resources page to see what‚Äôs included and other helpful downloads.

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
The Five Phases
This program is structured in five interconnected phases:

Phase 1: Orientation - Understand your role, the program structure, and set up your workspace
Phase 2: Discovery - Learn research methodologies and how to ask the right questions
Phase 3: The Dictionary - Master codebook creation and variable definition
Phase 4: Execution - Apply what you‚Äôve learned to real projects
Phase 5: Delivery - Present findings and communicate impact

Each phase builds on the previous one. Start with Phase 1 in the sidebar.

title: Deployment Guide
text: Congratulations! Your student resource website has been successfully built. Here‚Äôs how to deploy it for your students.

title: Deployment Guide
text: Congratulations! Your student resource website has been successfully built. Here‚Äôs how to deploy it for your students.

title: Deployment Guide
text:
What You Have
‚úÖ Quarto Website - A fully functional, professional resource site
‚úÖ Liaison Vault - Pre-configured Obsidian vault for students
‚úÖ Setup Instructions - Step-by-step guide for students
‚úÖ Built HTML - Ready to deploy (in the _site/ folder)

title: Deployment Guide
text:
Deployment Options

Option 1: GitHub Pages (Recommended - FREE)

Create a GitHub repository

Go to github.com and create a new public repo named quarto_website

Push your site
cd C:\mc451-sp26\quarto_website
git init
git add .
git commit -m "Initial commit: Liaison Program website"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/quarto_website.git
git push -u origin main
Enable GitHub Pages

Go to your repo Settings ‚Üí Pages
Set Source to ‚ÄúDeploy from a branch‚Äù
Set Branch to main and folder to _site
Your site will be live at: https://YOUR_USERNAME.github.io/quarto_website

Share the link in Blackboard

Copy the GitHub Pages URL
Add it to your Blackboard course as a web link or announcement




Option 2: Netlify (FREE, Easier Setup)

Go to netlify.com and sign up
Click ‚ÄúNew site from Git‚Äù and connect your GitHub repo
Set Build Command to: quarto render
Set Publish Directory to: _site
Deploy automatically on every push



Option 3: University Server/Portal
Contact your IT department about hosting the _site/ folder on your institution‚Äôs server.

title: Deployment Guide
text:
What Students See
When students visit your site, they‚Äôll find:

Home page - Welcome and quick-start buttons
Setup instructions - How to install and configure Obsidian
Resources page - Downloads (Liaison_Vault.zip and tools)
Five phase modules - Course content (01_orientation through 05_delivery)
Sidebar navigation - Easy access to all sections

title: Deployment Guide
text:
After Deployment

Share with Students
Add this to your Blackboard Course:
üìö Course Resources
Welcome! Access all course materials here: [YOUR_WEBSITE_URL]

On this site you'll find:
‚úì Your Liaison Obsidian Vault (download & setup)
‚úì Step-by-step getting started guide
‚úì All course modules and materials
‚úì Weekly templates and tools

Start with the Setup page if this is your first time!


Keep It Updated
After deployment, whenever you update content:

Edit your .qmd files in VS Code
Run quarto render to rebuild
Git commit and push to update the live site
git add .
git commit -m "Update course materials"
git push

title: Deployment Guide
text:
Customization Tips

Update Your Course Info
Edit index.qmd to add: - Instructor name and contact info - Meeting times and location - Office hours


Add More Content
Create new .qmd files in the modules/ folder and add them to _quarto.yml sidebar


Change the Theme
In _quarto.yml, change the theme from cosmo to: - darkly - Dark theme - readable - High contrast - lumen - Light and clean - spacelab - Modern


Add Syllabus
Create syllabus.qmd (it‚Äôs already referenced in the sidebar!)

title: Deployment Guide
text:
File Structure
quarto_website/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ _quarto.yml          # Site config & navigation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.qmd            # Home page
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ setup.qmd            # Getting started guide
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ syllabus.qmd         # Add your course syllabus here
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ build_vault.py       # Script that created your vault
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ resources/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.qmd        # Resources page
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Liaison_Vault.zip # Student download
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ modules/             # Course content (5 phases)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ slides/              # Presentation slides (optional)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ assignments/         # Assignment details (optional)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ _site/               # Built website (don't edit directly)

title: Deployment Guide
text:
Next Steps

Add your syllabus - Create/edit syllabus.qmd
Customize home page - Edit index.qmd with your details
Add module content - Fill in each phase (01-05) modules
Deploy - Choose Option 1, 2, or 3 above
Share link - Post in Blackboard for your students


Questions or need help? Let me know - I can help you customize this further!

title: Resources & Downloads
text:
Your complete knowledge management system for the Liaison Program. This vault includes:

00_Inbox: Quick capture area for notes and ideas
01_Journal: Weekly reflection templates (Connector/Troubleshooter/Critic)
02_Literature: Centralized space for reading notes and citations
03_Project: Active research work with codebooks and data organization
04_Resources: Attachment storage for images, PDFs, and media
99_Templates: Ready-to-use templates for assignments and documentation

üì• Download Liaison_Vault.zip - Extract this to get started immediately.

title: Resources & Downloads
text:
Software & Tools
Before starting Phase 1, ensure you have these installed:

Required

Obsidian - FREE - Your note-taking workspace
Git - FREE - Version control for your projects
VS Code - FREE - Code editor



Recommended

Python 3.10+ - FREE - For data analysis and automation
R & RStudio - FREE - Statistical analysis
